name: market for bleaching and dyeing, yarn | bleaching and dyeing, yarn | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20767/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'bleaching and dyeing, yarn', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This is delivering the service of 'bleaching and dyeing, yarn' and includes all necessary materials, energy, water, wastewater (produced within the process) and infrastructure in order to process 1 kg of yarn. Bleaching is a process where whitening agents are used in order to ensure a satisfactory clean material with white colour. Dyeing is a process that applies a uniform and desired colour on the material that is applied. A user should use this service alongside 1 kg of yarn of their choice.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
